title: Definitions
context: §373-1 Definitions. As used in this chapter, unless the context otherwise requires: &ldquo;Actual earnings from employment&rdquo; means the total compensation, including reported amount of tips for labor or services rendered by an employee, whether the amount is determined on a time, task, piece, commission, or other basis of calculation, but shall not include the reasonable cost to an employer of furnishing an employee with fringe benefits or board, lodging, or other facilities and non-cash gratuities of any kind. &ldquo;Applicant&rdquo; means any person who uses the services of an employment agency to secure employment for that person. &ldquo;Branch office&rdquo; means an employment agency office maintained away from the principal employment agency office. &ldquo;Director&rdquo; means the director of commerce and consumer affairs. &ldquo;Employer&rdquo; means any individual, partnership, corporation, or association, employing or seeking to employ any person for hire. &ldquo;Employment agency&rdquo; means any individual, partnership, corporation, or association engaged in the business of providing employment information, procuring employment for applicants, or procuring employees for placement with employers upon request, for a fee or other valuable thing, exacted, charged, or received, but shall not include the United States or the State or instrumentalities thereof. &ldquo;Gross wages, salaries, or commissions&rdquo; means the gross amount of the applicant&rsquo;s actual earnings from employment. &ldquo;Principal agent&rdquo; means the responsible managing agent who is responsible for managing an employment agency and who is responsible for all business transactions and actions by the agency&rsquo;s employees. [L 1959, c 264, pt of §3; am L Sp 1959 2d, c 1, §27; Supp, §88A-1; HRS §373-1; am L 1980, c 302, pt of §2; am L 1983, c 84, §1(2); am L 1985, c 135, §1; am L 2002, c 22, §1]
